com.comphenix.attribute

Class AttributeStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.comphenix.attribute.AttributeStorage

  • public class AttributeStorage
extends java.lang.Object
    Store meta-data in an ItemStack as attributes.
    Author:
    Kristian

    • Method Detail

      • newTarget

        public static AttributeStorage newTarget(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack target,
                                         java.util.UUID uniqueKey)
        Construct a new attribute storage system.

        The key must be the same in order to retrieve the same data.

        Parameters:
        target - - the item stack where the data will be stored.
        uniqueKey - - the unique key used to retrieve the correct data.

      • newTarget

        public static AttributeStorage newTarget(org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack target,
                                         java.util.UUID uniqueKey,
                                         java.util.List<Attributes.Attribute> attributes)
        Construct a new attribute storage system.

        The key must be the same in order to retrieve the same data.

        Parameters:
        target - - the item stack where the data will be stored.
        uniqueKey - - the unique key used to retrieve the correct data.
        attributes - - the list of attributes that will be added to the item stack

      • getData

        public java.lang.String getData(java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Retrieve the data stored in the item's attribute.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - - the default value to return if no data can be found.
        Returns:
        The stored data, or defaultValue if not found.

      • hasData

        public boolean hasData()
        Determine if we are storing any data.
        Returns:
        TRUE if we are, FALSE otherwise.

      • setData

        public void setData(java.lang.String data)
        Set the data stored in the attributes.
        Parameters:
        data - - the data.

      • getTarget

        public org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack getTarget()
        Retrieve the target stack. May have been changed.
        Returns:
        The target stack.
